# Qoqolo Photo Downloader - User Guide

A simple guide to help you install and use the Qoqolo Photo Downloader Chrome extension.

> Currently supports Portfolios, Class Activity, and Recent Sign-in/out export.

**Disclaimer**: This document is generated by AI with minor edits. This extension is not affiliated with Qoqolo, CommonTown, or any school.

## Installation

### Step 1: Download the Extension

1. Go to the **Releases** section of this repository (on GitHub, click on "Releases" in the right sidebar, or visit the repository's Releases page)
2. Download the latest release ZIP file (e.g., `qoqolo-photo-downloader-chrome-extension-v1_0_1.zip`)
3. Extract the ZIP file to a folder on your computer (remember where you saved it!)

### Step 2: Load the Extension in Chrome

1. Open Google Chrome
2. Click the three dots menu (â‹®) in the top-right corner
3. Go to **Extensions** â†’ **Manage extensions**
   - Or type `chrome://extensions/` in the address bar and press Enter
4. In the top-right corner, toggle **Developer mode** ON
5. Click the **Load unpacked** button
6. Navigate to and select the **extracted folder** (the one you extracted from the ZIP file)
7. The extension should now appear in your extensions list

### Step 3: Pin the Extension (Optional but Recommended)

1. Click the puzzle piece icon (ðŸ§©) in Chrome's toolbar
2. Find "Qoqolo Photo Downloader" in the list
3. Click the pin icon to keep it visible in your toolbar

## Updating the Extension

When a new version is available:

1. **Download the new release**:
   - Go to the **Releases** section of this repository
   - Download the latest release ZIP file
   - Extract it to a folder (you can replace the old folder or use a new one)
2. **Reload the extension in Chrome**:
   - Go to `chrome://extensions/`
   - Find "Qoqolo Photo Downloader" in your extensions list
   - Click the **reload icon** (ðŸ”„) on the extension card
3. That's it! The extension is now updated.

**Note:** If you're updating from a significantly older version, you may need to:
   - Remove the old extension from Chrome
   - Load the new extracted folder again using "Load unpacked"

## Switching Between Popup and Side Panel

The extension can work in two modes:

### Popup Mode (Default)

- Click the extension icon in Chrome's toolbar
- A small popup window appears

### Side Panel Mode

- Click the extension icon to open the popup
- Click the **toggle button** (ðŸ”„) in the top-right corner of the popup
- The extension will switch to side panel mode
- The side panel will appear on the right side of your browser window

**To switch back to popup mode:**

- Click the toggle button again in the side panel
- Note: The popup may not appear immediately. Click the extension icon again to see it.

## Where to Use the Extension

### Supported Pages

Currently, the extension works on:

- **Portfolios Page** - Navigate to: `Portfolios > Activity > Recent`
  - The URL should look like: `https://[your-school].qoqolo.com/cos/o.x?c=/[hash]/folio`
- **Class Activity Page** - Navigate to the Class Activity page with posts visible
  - The URL should look like: `https://[your-school].qoqolo.com/cos/o.x?c=/[hash]/classspace&func=view&gid=[id]&post_type=activity`
- **Recent Sign-in/out Page** - Navigate to the Recent Sign-in/out page
  - The URL should look like: `https://[your-school].qoqolo.com/cos/o.x?c=/[hash]/checkinout&func=recent`

## How to Use

The extension supports Portfolios, Class Activity, and Recent Sign-in/out pages. The usage is similar for all pages.

**Important**: It is recommended to scroll down the page first so that all activities (at least for the ones you wish to extract) are loaded. (This will be optimised in the future)

### Step 1: Navigate to the Page

1. Log in to your Qoqolo Student Portal
2. Navigate to the page:
   a. **Portfolios**: **Portfolios** â†’ **Activity** â†’ **Recent**
   b. **Class Activity**: **My Class** â†’ Select your class of interest â†’ **"All" tab**
   c. **Recent Sign-in/out**: Navigate to the Recent Sign-in/out page
3. Make sure you can see the list of activities/records that containing photos for usual cases.

#### Step 2-7: Use the Extension (see below)

### Step 2: Open the Extension

1. Click the Qoqolo Photo Downloader icon in Chrome's toolbar
2. The extension interface will open (either as a popup or side panel)

### Step 3: Set Date Range (Optional)

You can filter activities by date:

- **From**: Select a month and year to start crawling from (leave empty to start from the earliest displayed)
- **To**: Select a month and year to end crawling at (leave empty to go to the latest)

**Note:** The "Start Crawl" button will be disabled if "From" date is later than "To" date.

**Special behavior for Recent Sign-in/out:**
- Empty "From": Crawls backward chronologically until no data is found for 5 consecutive months
- Empty "To": Starts from the current month
- Months without data are not included in the results

### Step 4: Start Crawling

1. Click the **Start Crawl** button
2. The extension will automatically:
   - Extract information from each activity/month
   - Display items in real-time as they're processed
   - Show progress in the list
3. You can click **Stop** at any time to cancel the crawl
   - **Note for Recent Sign-in/out**: When you click Stop, the current month's photos will finish processing before stopping to avoid partial months

**Important:**

- Keep the page open and don't navigate away while crawling
- If your login session expires, you'll see an alert. Refresh the page and try again.

### Step 5: Review Extracted Items

As items are crawled, you'll see them listed with:

**For Portfolios and Class Activity:**
- Title
- Link to the original activity
- Images (with captions if available)
- Content/description
- Learning areas
- Teacher name
- Publish date
- Stickers

**For Recent Sign-in/out:**
- Month (year-month)
- Link to the month page
- Daily records table with:
  - Date
  - Drop-off and pick-up times (24-hour format)
  - Drop-off and pick-up persons
  - Comments
  - Check-in and check-out photo links
- Total images count

### Step 6: Copy or Export

For each item, you have two options:

- **Copy**: Copies the item's content as markdown text to your clipboard
  - A "Copied" message will briefly appear
- **Export**: Downloads the item as a ZIP file
  - **Portfolios/Class Activity**: Contains all images and a markdown file with the activity details
  - **Recent Sign-in/out**: Contains CSV (without photo URLs), JSON (with full data including photo links), and all images

### Step 7: Batch Download (All Items)

1. After crawling is complete, click the **Download** button in the action bar
2. The extension will:
   - Create a folder for each activity
   - Download all images with numbered prefixes (e.g., `01_image.jpg`)
   - Create a markdown file in each folder
   - Zip everything into one file
3. The batch ZIP filename will be:
   - Portfolios: `qoqolo-portfolio-yyyy_mm-yyyy_mm.zip`
   - Class Activity: `qoqolo-class-activity-yyyy_mm-yyyy_mm.zip`
   - Recent Sign-in/out: `qoqolo-check-in-out-yyyy_mm-yyyy_mm.zip`
   - The dates represent the earliest and latest activity/month dates in the batch

**Note:** The Download button is only available when:

- You have at least one crawled item
- You're not currently crawling

A progress bar will appear at the bottom of the action bar during batch download.

## Tips

- **Date Range**: Use the date pickers to limit crawling to specific months, which can save time
- **Session Expiry**: If crawling stops unexpectedly, check if your login session expired
- **Large Batches**: Batch downloads can take a while if you have many items with many images. Be patient!
- **Individual Exports**: You can export individual items while crawling is still in progress
- **Copy Feature**: Use the Copy button to quickly share activity content in markdown format

## Troubleshooting

### Extension Not Working?

1. Make sure you're on a supported page:
   - Portfolios: `Portfolios > Activity > Recent`
   - Class Activity: Class Activity page with posts visible
   - Recent Sign-in/out: Recent Sign-in/out page
2. Check if the extension icon shows any error badges
3. Try reloading the extension from `chrome://extensions/`
4. Refresh the Qoqolo page and try again

### Crawling Stops Unexpectedly?

1. Check if your login session expired (you'll see an alert)
2. Refresh the Qoqolo page
3. Make sure you don't navigate away from the page while crawling
4. Try clicking "Start Crawl" again

### Can't See the Extension Icon?

1. Go to `chrome://extensions/`
2. Find "Qoqolo Photo Downloader"
3. Make sure it's enabled (toggle is ON)
4. Click the puzzle piece icon (ðŸ§©) in Chrome's toolbar
5. Pin the extension if it's not already pinned

### Download Not Working?

1. Check your browser's download settings
2. Make sure Chrome isn't blocking downloads
3. Check if you have enough disk space
4. Try exporting individual items first to test

## Need Help?

If you encounter issues not covered here, check the developer console:

1. Right-click on the extension popup/side panel
2. Select "Inspect"
3. Look for any error messages in the Console tab

---

**Note:** This extension only works with Qoqolo Student Portal. It does not send any data to external servers - all processing happens locally in your browser.
